name: windblown
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
carried by the wind: They say that windblown pollen from the genetically modified trees could affect other nearby forests in unpredictable ways. Researchers suspect that wind-blown pollution lies behind the multiple sheep deaths.
affected by or not protected from the wind: These river valleys crossing the windblown desert of coastal Peru were once home to an early urban society. In the photo she looked tanned, with windblown hair. Drivers will race across the wind-blown Sahara Desert in Mauritania. Compare
windswept
More examplesFewer examplesThe plants here live off rain and windblown nutrients.Vehicles kicked up clouds of ash on the roads and windblown particles obscured the sun.There was wind-blown litter caught in the bushes.They come from the wind-blown plains of Central Asia.
